tip: include junit4 runner, annotations, and assertions in JUnit5
push image to github docker registry
codex:
docker login -u ‹USERNAME› -p ‹TOKEN› docker.pkg.github.com
docker push docker.pkg.github.com/liufa/testdockerandk8/dockerandk8test:0.1

Here, replace USERNAME with your username and TOKEN with the personal access token generated with read/write/delete:packages enabled in https://github.com/settings/tokens

tip: open copilot for multiple suggestions - shortcut keys
list all the deployments in the default namespace
codex: kubectl get deployment kubectl get deployments

tip: create deployment that deploy pods with dynamic image name
codex:
kubectl create deployment ‹deployment_name› --image=‹image_name›
(i.e., kubectl create deployment ngnix --image=nginx)

kubectl delete service ‹service_name› --namespace ‹namespace_name›
(i.e., kubectl delete service zalenium --namespace zalenium)

tip: list all the services from entire namespace
list all the services with selector filter
codex:
kubectl get services --all-namespaces --selector=‹selector_name›
(i.e., kubectl get services --all-namespaces --selector=app.kubernetes.io/name=zalenium -o wide)

tip: list all the services with details [selector]
codex:
kubectl get services --namespace ‹namespace_name› -o wide
(i.e., kubectl get services --namespace zalenium -o wide)

tip: list all the services in another namespace
codex:
kubectl get services --namespace ‹namespace_name›
(i.e., kubectl get services --namespace zalenium)

tip: list all the services in default namespace

codex:
kubectl delete namespace ‹namespace_name›
(i.e., kubectl delete --all pods --namespace=zalenium
kubectl delete namespace zalenium)

tip: list all namespaces with namespace counts

codex:
kubectl get namespace ‹namespace_name› --show-labels
(i.e., kubectl get namespace zalenium --show-labels)

tip: list all the namespaces with labels

codex:
kubectl create namespace ‹namespace_name›
(i.e., kubectl create namespace zalenium)

kubectl describe node ‹node_name›
(i.e., kubectl describe node minikube)

[with namespace]

[with status deployed]
helm ls --all --namespace=sitespeedio | grep DEPLOYED | awk '{print$1}'

[with namespace]
helm install --name sitespeedio . --namespace=sitespeedio

[without name - create release with random name]
helm install . --namespace=sitespeedio

codex:
docker rename ‹container_id› ‹target_container_name›
docker rename ‹container_name› ‹target_container_name›
(i.e, docker rename 49c19634177c sams)

[update single container]
docker update --restart=always ‹container_id›

[update all the available containers]
docker update --restart=no $(docker ps -a -q)

helm3 repo add stable https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com
helm3 repo ls
helm3 fetch stable/prometheus-operator
helm3 install ‹release-name› -n ‹namespace› stable/prometheus-operator

helm delete ‹release-name›
helm3 del ‹release-name›
helm3 del ‹release-name› --namespace ‹namespace›

[note: --purge is not required as it is handled by default]

helm3 install ‹chart-name› ‹chart-location›
helm3 install grafana .
helm3 install grafana . --namespace ‹namespace›

helm3 install --generate-name .
[note: no need to mention --name in helm3]

tip: basic terraform script to create a EC2 instance
codex:
provider "aws" {
version = "~> 2.0"
region = "us-west-2"
shared_credentials_file = "~/.aws/credentials"
profile = "prashanth"
}

data "aws_ami" "amazon-linux-2" {
most_recent = true
owners = ["amazon"]

filter {
name = "name"
values = ["amzn2-ami-hvm*"]
}

filter {
name = "architecture"
values = ["x86_64"]
}

}
resource "aws_instance" "test" {
ami = "${data.aws_ami.amazon-linux-2.id}"
associate_public_ip_address = true
instance_type = "t2.micro"
}

import sqldump with tables one by one

tip: sqldump all tables one by one from a database
codex:
for T in `mysql --skip-column-names -h 127.0.0.1 -u root -P 3366 -e 'show tables from databasename' -pc8JjJ4a`; do echo $T; mysqldump -u root -h 127.0.0.1 -P 3366 databasename $T -pc8JjQ5J4a --set-gtid-purged=OFF --column-statistics=0 > $T.sql; done;
for T in `mysql -h 127.0.0.1 -u root -P 3366 -e 'show tables from databasename' -pc8JjAQ5J4a`; if [[ $T != *Table* ]]; then mysqldump -u root -h 127.0.0.1 -P 3366 databasename $T -pc8JjMQ5J4a --set-gtid-purged=OFF --column-statistics=0 > $T.sql; else continue; fi;

const { exec } = require("child_process");

desc('Runner Task');
task('run', function (environment, country) {
exec("ls -la", (error, stdout, stderr) => {
if (error) {
console.log(`error: ${error.message}`);
return;
}
if (stderr) {
console.log(`stderr: ${stderr}`);
return;
}
console.log(`stdout: ${stdout}`);
});
});
